prompts.prompt:
Create Weather App usin any free open source API available on Internet
1. Design:
Layout:
Responsive Design: Ensure the app looks good on all devices, using Tailwind CSS for responsive utilities.
Header: Includes the app name and a tagline.
Search Bar: Allows users to search for weather by city name or ZIP code.
Weather Display: Shows current weather and forecast.
Footer: Contains attribution to the weather data provider and any other necessary information.
Styling:
Color Scheme: Use a color palette that reflects different weather conditions (e.g., blue tones for clear skies, grey for overcast, etc.).
Icons: Use weather icons to visually represent different weather conditions.
Typography: Choose readable fonts from Tailwind's font stack for text elements.
Animations & Interactions:
Loading State: An animated loader for when data is being fetched.
Transition Effects: Smooth transitions for changing weather information.
Hover Effects: Subtle hover effects on clickable elements for better UX.
2. Features:
Core Features:
Current Weather: Display the current weather, including temperature, humidity, wind speed, etc.
Dynamic Backgrounds: The background changes to reflect current weather conditions (e.g., sunny, cloudy, rainy).
Search Functionality:
Auto-Complete: Suggest city names as the user types, using a debounce technique to limit API calls.
Error Handling: Display user-friendly error messages for incorrect searches or when data can't be retrieved.
